name: Siwandu

reviews.text: We spent 3 days of our honeymoon at the Selous Safari camp. We had an amazing experience. The wildlife was excellent while we were there. We were luck enough to see lions, african hunting dogs, hippos, elephants, girafes, etc. The food was excellent and the service was amazing. It was the perfect place to spend part of our honeymoon.
reviews.title: An Amazing Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a two week trip to Tanzania and spent three nights on safari at the Selous Private Camp. It has only four tented safari villas (the main camp has 9).
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — Go the the private camp rather than the mian camp if you can

reviews.title: Brilliant Safari Option in Southern Tanzania
reviews.text: We loved it there, amazing 5 star tented accommodation, outstanding food and superb service. It way exceeded our expectations. We would definitely advise that is worth paying the extra to stay at the Private Camp vs. the Main Camp. It is just that bit extra special with only 8 guests max., inclusive of all drinks and personal butler service.

reviews.title: Very Special
reviews.text: The camp offers walking, driving and boating safari options. We would highly recommend this place vs. others that can only offer driving safari. The variety was wonderful, with great guides and loads of animals to see. On a morning walking safari we came round a corner to find a "bush breakfast" all set up for the 6 in our group. It was amazing to sit there in the bush eating a full breakfast and drinking fresh tea and juice.
All in all we would highly rate this camp.
reviews.title: A very special experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Almost dont want to recommend it as wed like to keep it to ourselves but it was superb. Yes we were there for our honeymoon too along with most couples it has to be said but god it was good. Amazing wildlife and luxurious accommodation with phenominally caring and attentive staff. One day I sincerely hope we will go back. We will be lucky indeed if we do.
reviews.title: Very Very Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Selous Safari Camp for 4 nights in August. We had a lovely time and saw tons of animals up close - including an amazing pride of lions. For first-time safari-ers like us it was a great introduction to the wild!
reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were wonderful, particularly Justin, the main guide at Private camp, and Kiedege who does the boating safaris.
reviews.title: Loved it - perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tents are luxurious and come with their own butler. The animals from the lake regularly come up and graze right next to the tents in the night, which makes for some pretty amazing night viewing from the comfort of your bed!
reviews.title: Doesn't quite hit the mark
Great Experience all in all
reviews.text: The food is very good, especially considering the remoteness of the location. Better yet, the restaurant overlooks the lake-side, and animals from elephants to giraffe to baboons regulalrly cruise past EXTREMELY CLOSE during meals (see attached pic).

We stayed at the Private camp which has only 4 tents, and is self-contained from the main camp. This makes for a very personal level of service from the staff which is great. However, it also means that everyone at Private camp (normally 4 couples and guides) all dine together in the evening. On the one hand this is good, (if you like the other people!), but for a honeymoon it was quite an intense level of contact to have with other guests, given that you also spend large parts of your day out viewing with the same individuals. We met some great people, but could also have used some more alone-time...
reviews.title: The most amazing place ever

reviews.text: Waking up to two elephants outside your tent munching on trees is an incredable experience. We were lucky enough to stay at Selous private which is a four tent private camp adjacent to the main camp - which has about 12 tents. Staff were astonishing especially as my new wife had what they affectionality called 'runny tummy.' Guides are really good and on ride from airstrip to camp we saw giraffe, impala, hyena and many birds. Its a really lovely place and very isolated which means no crowds as on many Kenyan safaris. Kinda feels like something from early colonial days. game drives are awesome but make sure you do a sunset river trip too. that is truly breathtaking. bring a good camera with 300mm lens. Fulfilled all our dreams and hopes for what a safari would be. Its expensive but honeslty worth every penny. early July seemed like great time to go too. the hardest part was leaving. Cool thing here is that they buy and give seeds to a local village who then grows all their produce. nice way of suporting locals as well as assuring fresh fruit and veg! Food is very good.
reviews.title: Decedant luxury and lots and lots of wildwife

aka: Selous Safari Camp Hotel Selous Game Reserve
description: The Selous Safari Camp is delightfully situated within an open palm forest on the shores of Lake Nzerakera, a massive lake adjoining the Great Rufiji River. All safari tents are widely spaced along the lake shore ensuring maximum privacy and wonderful views. Blending in superbly with its natural surroundings in what is one of the most photogenic areas of the Selous Game Reserve, with incredible game viewing including the rare African Wild Dog.
